{"data": {"production":{"id":"eternal_sunshine_of_the_spotless_mind","production_title":"Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind","production_status":3,"production_desc":"

Jim Carrey<\/strong><\/span><\/a> heads the cast of Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind<\/em><\/strong>, directed by Michel Gondry<\/strong><\/span><\/a> from Academy Award nominee Charlie Kaufman's<\/strong><\/span><\/a> (Adaptation.<\/em><\/strong><\/span><\/a>) original screenplay. The two-time Golden Globe Award winner is joined in the movie by three-time Academy Award nominee Kate Winslet<\/strong><\/span><\/a>, Kirsten Dunst<\/strong><\/span><\/a>, Tom Wilkinson<\/strong><\/span><\/a>, Mark Ruffalo<\/strong><\/span><\/a>, and Elijah Wood<\/strong><\/span><\/a>.<\/p>

Joel (Jim Carrey) is stunned to discover that his girlfriend Clementine (Kate Winslet) has had her memories of their tumultuous relationship erased. Out of desperation, he contacts the inventor of the process, Dr. Howard Mierzwiak (Tom Wilkinson), to have Clementine removed from his own memory. But as Joel's memories progressively disappear, he begins to rediscover his love for Clementine. From deep within the recesses of his brain, Joel attempts to escape the procedure. As Dr. Mierzwiak and his crew (Kirsten Dunst, Mark Ruffalo, Elijah Wood) chase him through the maze of his memories, it's clear that Joel just can't get Clementine out of his head.<\/p>","in_theaters":"
